main event: Four employees of the DuPont Company at the Savannah River Plant in Ellenton, South Carolina observed several disc-shaped objects on May 4, 1952.
interesting points: The objects approached from the south, disappeared to the north, then approached from the northeast and disappeared to the southwest.
One of the objects had a slight trail about 200 yards long.
The objects were described as yellow or white in color, about 15 inches in diameter to the naked eye, and flying at a very high altitude.
The objects were only visible for a few seconds due to their high speed and altitude.
The sighting was reported to the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the Atomic Energy Commission.
witnesses: Four employees of the DuPont Company
